result.execSummary:
All charges against Lloyd Edward Mitchell Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lloyd Edward Mitchell Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Chapman states there is an agreement regarding motion. State moves to dismiss. Court dismisses case based on agreement of the parties. Notice to Appear will be given for re-filed case. Current: 306 Sidney St E, Saint Paul, MN 55107 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 777 East Napier Apt 52, Benton Harbor, MI 49022 United States
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Not to possess or use firearms, body armor or police paraphernalia, including badges, uniforms or caps

- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs

02:48 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Lloyd Edward Mitchell appeared from jail. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG, preserves on motion. Atty. Chapman reviews motion. DA Anderson anticipates an amended information to be filed. Atty. Chapman makes bond argument. Court amends bond. Court setes PSC. Adjourned: 3:05 PM. kma  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:34 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   ADA:   Alex Ballo    DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Lloyd Edward Mitchell appeared from jail.  State calls SCCO Investigator Michael O'Keefe.  Witness sworn.  State direct.  Witness identifies DF.  Atty Chapman cross.  Witness excused.  Atty arguments.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Chapman requests bond hearing. Bond continues.  Adjourned: 3:02  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
